decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Marath's ability to create tokens and pump them up, while also having the ability to search for key pieces and interact with the opponent's board. The deck includes a mix of creature tutors, removal spells, and powerful creatures to take advantage of Marath's abilities. The deck also includes various mana dorks and ramp spells to ensure that Marath can be cast early and often. With a strong mana base to support the deck's powerful spells and abilities, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and powerful combo plays, while also being able to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a variety of removal spells and hatebears.

The deck revolves around using Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander to create a combo strategy. The deck includes a variety of removal spells, card draw engines, and ramp spells to control the game and set up the combo win condition. It also features powerful cards like Shared Animosity, Goblin Bombardment, and Purphoros, God of the Forge to boost the effectiveness of the combo. With a mix of creature support, disruption, and resource acceleration, the deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent to secure victory. The inclusion of key cards like Phyrexian Arena, Liliana of the Veil, and Karn Liberated adds additional versatility and control options to the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing the commander, Marath, Will of the Wild, to create a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck includes a wide range of mana ramp creatures and mana-fixing lands to ensure Marath can be cast early and often. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Restoration Angel, as well as combo pieces like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Zealous Conscripts. The inclusion of cards like Birthing Pod and Survival of the Fittest allows for tutor effects to help find key pieces quickly. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game, overwhelming opponents with a combination of speed and versatility.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to play powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. With cards like Birds of Paradise, Elvish Mystic, and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to accelerate its mana production early on. The key strategy is to get Xenagos, God of Revels on the battlefield as soon as possible to give a huge power boost to creatures, allowing for fast and deadly attacks. The deck includes a variety of high-value creatures like Atarka, World Render, Inferno Titan, and Primeval Titan to capitalize on Xenagos's ability. With powerful ramp and big threats, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck revolves around utilizing Kaalia of the Vast to cheat powerful angels, demons, and dragons into play from your hand. The goal is to quickly assemble a threatening board state filled with big, impactful creatures that can end the game in just a few turns. The deck includes a variety of removal and disruption spells to control the board and protect your creatures, while also running ramp to ensure you can consistently get Kaalia onto the battlefield. By efficiently deploying your high-powered threats and controlling the game with removal and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory through a powerful combination of creatures and spells.

The central theme of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and disruptive spells while utilizing Keranos, God of Storms as the commander to provide additional card advantage and damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on maintaining a strong board presence through a combination of control spells, card draw, and powerful creatures like Thing in the Ice and Snapcaster Mage. By disrupting the opponent's strategy and keeping the battlefield in check, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent, ultimately leading to victory through superior resource management and strategic decision-making. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to consistently control the pace of the game and adapt to various situations.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo with Prossh, Skyraider of Kher as the commander. It includes a toolbox of tutors and card draw spells to find key pieces quickly, such as Goblin Bombardment, Earthcraft, and Purphoros, God of the Forge. The deck also includes mana ramp and acceleration cards like Birds of Paradise and Rampant Growth to help cast Prossh and other combo pieces early. The goal is to generate a large number of tokens with Prossh, then sacrifice them to deal direct damage to opponents with Goblin Bombardment or Purphoros. The deck also includes removal spells to control the board and ensure the combo can go off smoothly.

The main strategy of this deck is to assemble different combos that can generate infinite mana or token creatures, allowing for a quick and overwhelming win condition. The deck also includes a variety of removal and disruption spells to control the board and protect the combo pieces until they can be assembled. Prossh, Skyraider of Kher serves as both a powerful threat on its own and a key piece in several of the combos included in the deck. The mana base is carefully curated to support the deck's three-color requirements and includes a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana.
